definition: see 薑還是老的辣|姜还是老的辣[jiang1 hai2 shi4 lao3 de5 la4]
ginger
surname Jiang
variant of 薑|姜[jiang1]
is/are/am/yes/to be
variant of 是[shi4]/(used in given names)

prefix used before the surname of a person or a numeral indicating the order of birth of the children in a family or to indicate affection or familiarity/old (of people)/venerable (person)/experienced/of long standing/always/all the time/of the past/very/outdated/(of meat etc) tough
see 的士[di1 shi4]
of/~'s (possessive particle)/(used after an attribute)/(used to form a nominal expression)/(used at the end of a declarative sentence for emphasis)
aim/clear
really and truly
old variant of 辣[la4]
hot (spicy)/pungent
ginger gets spicier as it gets older (idiom)/the older, the wiser
pinyin: jiang1 hai2 shi4 lao3 de5 la4

definition: lit. to dispatch a general is not as effective as to excite a general/fig. inciting people to action is more effective than dispatching orders
pinyin: qing3 jiang4 bu4 ru2 ji1 jiang4

definition: the sage presents as an ordinary person (idiom)
cunning/crafty/wily old fox
a much-travelled person, well acquainted with the ways of the world
rigorous schemes and deep foresight (idiom); astute and circumspect
variant of 老奸巨猾[lao3 jian1 ju4 hua2]
He who comes is surely ill-intentioned, no-one well-meaning will come (idiom)./Be careful not to trust foreigners./Beware of Greeks bearing gifts!
pinyin: lai2 zhe3 bu4 shan4 , shan4 zhe3 bu4 lai2

definition: the young will be redoubtable in the years to come (idiom)/the younger generations will surpass us in time
you can't judge a person by appearance (idiom)/you can't judge a book by its cover/often in combination 人不可貌相，海水不可斗量[ren2 bu4 ke3 mao4 xiang4 , hai3 shui3 bu4 ke3 dou3 liang2]
however strong you are, there is always someone stronger (idiom)/there is always sth more to learn/never be satisfied to rest on your laurels/there is no room for complacency
pinyin: qiang2 zhong1 zi4 you3 qiang2 zhong1 shou3

definition: nobody understands one's son better than his father (idiom)
lit. father a lion, son cannot be a dog (honorific); With a distinguished father such as you, the son is sure to do well./like father, like son
there are no poor soldiers under a good general (idiom)
pinyin: qiang2 jiang4 shou3 xia4 wu2 ruo4 bing1

definition: see 強中自有強中手|强中自有强中手[qiang2 zhong1 zi4 you3 qiang2 zhong1 shou3]
pinyin: qiang2 zhong1 geng4 you3 qiang2 zhong1 shou3

definition: Only an outstanding talent can recognize current trends (idiom). A wise man submits to circumstances.
pinyin: shi2 shi2 wu4 zhe3 wei4 jun4 jie2
